page.title: 17Kettlestouns Mains Quarry
page.content: In 1969 Russells of Denny tried, unsccessfully, to excavate sand and gravel from a site at Kettlestoun Mains. This year (1985) Scottish Aggregates Ltd. have been given permission to dig and they will take about 500,000 tons of sand and gravel to Kinneil Mill Washery Plant and it will be used for making concrete. All the people living in Belsyde Court and Avontoun Park Housing Estates, which are near to the access road to the quarry, are complaining for two main reasons:(1) The vehicles that pass by the two areas are a danger to the children on the streets and (2) the dust would sweep over these places endangering the quality of the residents lives.
